meanings.definition: To cover with a layer of stones or concrete to prevent erosion.
meanings.sent1: The workers were riprapping the riverbank to stop the soil from washing away.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew is riprapping the coastline to protect it from the strong waves.
meanings.sent3: The riprapping project turned into a fun team-building exercise for the workers.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a riprapping shield against the harsh criticism.
meanings.sent5: The riprapping process transformed the vulnerable area into a sturdy barrier against erosion.

meanings.definition: A protective covering of stones or concrete used to prevent erosion.
meanings.sent1: The riprapping along the riverbank held back the water and prevented erosion.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge was reinforced with riprapping to ensure its stability.
meanings.sent3: The children enjoyed playing hide-and-seek among the riprapping along the shore.
meanings.sent4: The riprapping resembled a fortress guarding the land from erosion.
meanings.sent5: The riprapping glistened in the sunlight, a testament to its protective strength.
